Viability theory 33 aims to preserve some set of desired properties (denoted by K) of a dynamical system. In the viability framework, controls are explicit expressed in the dynamics and not fixed beforehand. Instead, the goal is to find relevant management strategies (not necessarily “optimal” according to a certain criterion) that will maintain the system within its state constraint set K.
